data.name: Setup_ADConfigure_TestPrompt
data.value: When you click next uManage will attempt to connect and test the connection to the domain. This test ensures you have the proper permissions to access the domain and modify user settings.

data.name: Setup_ADConfigure_VerifyPassword
data.value: Verify Password:

data.name: Setup_Database_AutoConfigure
data.value: Automatically Configure the Database?

data.name: Setup_Database_Footer
data.value: The connection to the database server will be verified when you click next, the database will not be created until the end of the wizard.

data.name: Setup_Database_Message
data.value: In order to simplify the database installation process as much as possible this setup wizard is capable of connecting to your server, creating the database and creating a secure user account to run under. However it is understood that in some cases you may already have a database setup or would like to setup the database yourself. To allow uManage to setup the database for you make sure you click the checkbox below and enter the needed information. In addition if you let uManage create the database for you it will also add a domain user account to the required roles automatically to cut down on the setup time.

data.name: Setup_Database_Password
data.value: SA Password:

data.name: Setup_Database_Server
data.value: Server Address:

data.name: Setup_Database_Title
data.value: Database Configuration

data.name: Setup_Database_UserAccount
data.value: Domain User:

data.name: Setup_Error_AdUser_Message
data.value: The user account specified was invalid or could not be found in the directory. Please select a different user account.

data.name: Setup_Error_AdUser_Title
data.value: User Invalid!

data.name: Setup_Error_Database_Message
data.value: uManage was unable to either connect to the database server or validate the SA credentials specified are allowed to perform the required actions. Verify the server is online and available and that you specified the correct credentials.

data.name: Setup_Error_Database_Title
data.value: Failed to Connect to the Database Server

data.name: Setup_Error_Domain_Message
data.value: uManage was unable to either connect to the domain or validate that the user credentials specified are allowed to perform all required actions. Verify your domain is available and ensure the user being used has the proper permissions.

data.name: Setup_Error_Domain_Title
data.value: Failed to Connect to the Domain

data.name: Setup_Error_License
data.value: The license file could not be read. uManage is supposed to have a license file in the root web directory otherwise it will not configure itself properly. Don't try to steal this software!

data.name: Setup_Invalid_ComparePassword
data.value:
Invalid Entry!
The password verification did not match the original password. Please ensure both password's match.

data.name: Setup_Invalid_DbServer
data.value:
Invalid Entry!
You must enter a database server to connect to.

data.name: Setup_Invalid_Domain

Invalid Entry!
You must enter a domain name to connect to.

data.name: Setup_Invalid_Password
data.value:
Invalid Entry!
You must enter a password.

data.name: Setup_Invalid_UserAccount
data.value:
Invalid Entry!
You must enter a domain user account to add to uManage.

data.name: Setup_Invalid_Username
data.value:
Invalid Entry!
You must enter a username for the account with permission to modify the domain.

data.name: Setup_LicenseAgreement
data.value: By clicking next you agree to abide by the license.

data.name: Setup_LicenseMessage
data.value:
License Agreement

uManage is license under the Microsoft Public License or Ms-PL. You must agree to the license before you may use or redistribute the software. If you redistribute the software the license file must always accompany the software.

data.name: Setup_PortalSettings_Title
data.value: Select settings that affect what typical users can see and/or change when they use the self-service portal.

data.name: Setup_ProcessMessage
data.value:
How Setup Works

In order to get uManage running this setup wizard will do the following:

  1. Tell you about the application - Done!
  2. Tell you what we need to configure - Done!
  3. Accept the license agreement
  4. Connect to your domain
  5. Create a database
  6. Setup an admin user
  7. Select the Self-Service Portal settings
  8. Use uManage!

data.name: Setup_Summary_Prompt
data.value: When you click next the system will configure the application with the options above, recycle the application, disable the setup wizard and redirect you to the user portal. This could take a minute to complete.

data.name: Setup_Summary_Title
data.value: uManage has already confirmed a successful connection to the domain, however you should still confirm the selections below and make any last minute changes before you click finish. Once you click finish the system will be configured and you will no longer be able to access this wizard.

data.name: Setup_Summary_Username
data.value: Connecting as: {0}

data.name: Setup_Title
data.value: uManage Setup Wizard

data.name: Setup_WelcomeMessage
data.value:
Welcome to uManage!

uManage is a web application designed to assist organizations with helping to handle much of the user load generated by simple tasks like creating users as well as managing user information in Microsoft’s Active Directory system. It allows for other departments in an organization like Human Resources to take an active part in streamlining the new hire and termination process for any organization while freeing IT resources for more intensive or important tasks.

Before you can utilize uManage you must configure a few settings. You must also have administrative access to your domain controller to properly configure uManage, however uManage does not require administrative access to run.
